Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Improvisation \Im*prov`i*sa"tion\, n. [Cf. F. improvisation.] 1. The act or art of composing and rendering music, poetry, and the like, extemporaneously; as, improvisation on the organ. [1913 Webster]
2. That which is improvised; an impromptu. [1913 Webster]

improvisation n 1: a creation spoken or written or composed extemporaneously (without prior preparation) 2: an unplanned expedient [syn: {temporary expedient}] 3: a performance given extempore without planning or preparation [syn: {extemporization}, {extemporisation}]
